column4: no i need to change permissions of eggdrop modules folder for eggdrop to work?
do8
do i need to change permissions of eggdrop modules folder for eggdrop to work?
- you need not change any permissions to run an eggy. depending on where you install it. e.g., ~/homedir
- i know of no one who has gotten the ubuntu eggdrop to work. install from source tarball and edir eggdrop.conf
- get a real copy of eggdrop, tar -zxvf eggdrop.tar.gz then cd eggdrop.xxx then ./configure : make : make install : edit eggdrop.conf. simple.
- it installed in the wrong place.
- it did not install at all imo.
i did sudo apt-get install eggdrop
- get the source tarball and compile it. the synaptic install or apt-get install eggdrop never worked for anyone i know of.
- it might complain about missing tcl stuff but synaptic has tcl somewhere.
- you cant hurt anything trying
- un-install that synaptic eggy POS
- sudo apt-get autoremove eggdrop
- http://www.eggheads.org/   get your compile-feet wet :)
build-essential somtin like that?
- yes, you will need build-essential to compile anything
- sudo apt-get install build-essential
- open synaptic and enable universe and multiverse
- it's in the development repo
- try #eggdrop channel. build-essential is definetly available.
- what is the error?
